intro: Phytocrene borneensis, commonly known as the Bornean phytocrene, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments and has elliptical leaves with a smooth surface. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, berry-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
